crb_roadside package

Submodules

crb_roadside.find_trees module

crb_roadside.find_trees.find_trees(model, image_path: str)

Detects coconut palm trees in an image using YOLOE model. Annotated images and cropped detections in the automatically created ‘annotated_images’ directory.

IMPORTANT NOTES:

Requires a GPU with at least 8GB of VRAM to run successfully. If you attempt to run it on a machine without a suitable GPU, it will likely fail with an out-of-memory error.

When first executed, this script will download the YOLOE-11L-Seg model weights (~90MB) and mobileclip_blt.ts (~300MB) These files are too large for pushing to GitHub so they should be added to .gitignore

Usage:

import crb_roadside as crb

try:

model

except NameError:

model = crb.initialize_model()

image_path = “/home/aubrey/Desktop/Efate2025/original_images/20251129_152106.jpg” results = crb.find_trees(image_path)

crb_roadside.find_trees.initialize_model()

Initializes and returns the YOLOE model for coconut palm tree detection.

crb_roadside.update_db module

crb_roadside.update_db.update_detections_table(results, image_path, db_path)
crb_roadside.update_db.update_images_table(image_path, db_path)

Gets image data from embedded EXIF metadata and saves it in a SQLite database.
